newsitem.title: UK: JIB Group surges after merger news.
newsitem.headline: JIB Group surges after merger news.

text.p: Shares in JIB Group surged by more than 20 percent to a new high for the year after the UK insurance broker said it had reached an agreement with Lloyds Thompson Group to merge operations.
At 0836 GMT, JIB shares were up 22-1/2p to 131-1/2p.

"Insurance brokers are going throught very difficult times and any activity that will enhance margins has to be beneficial," said one analyst. "It's becoming quite evident that size is becoming more and more important."
Rumours of more consolidation in the insurance brokering industry bubbled over last week with rumours that Aon Corp or Marsh & McLennan Cos of the U.S. would bid for Britain's Sedgwick Group.

The advance in JIB shares lent strength to the insurance sector. Shares in Sedgwick were up 4p to 130-1/2p. Shares in Commercial Union, also the subject of bid speculation, climbed 8p to 673p, while shares in General Accident rose 6-1/2p to 694-1/2p.
